title: The 'antaresRead' Package
text: antaresRead package depends packages data.table, plyr lubridate. already got can install following command: can install antaresRead package either Rstudio assistant “Packages” tab following command:
code: install.packages(c("data.table", "plyr", "lubridate")) install.packages("path_to_the_package/antaresRead_***.zip")

title: The 'antaresRead' Package
text: First, start new R session, need load package: display list functions package access help pages, type R console: can start using package. first function use setSimulationPath. function needs called least R session. stores important informations used functions package. run, functions work. Without argument, setSimulationPath asks interactively choose directory containing antares study. study contains multiple simulation results, also asks user choose one . function stores path output reads useful information simulation: type output available, list areas, links clusters simulation, variables present output files, etc. setSimulationPath can also used non-interactive way one syntaxes: function returns object containing informations selected simulation. can store object variable later use necessary moment can retrieve informations.
code: library(antaresRead) help(package = "antaresRead") # Specify full path setSimulationPath("study_path/output/simulation_name")  # Specify the name of the simulation setSimulationPath("study_path", simulation_name)  # Select a simulation by order setSimulationPath("study_path", 1) # first simulation  # Select a simulation by reverse order setSimulationPath("study_path", -1) # last simulation  # It is possible to store in a variable the result of the function opts <- setSimulationPath("study_path", 1)

title: The 'antaresRead' Package
text: setSimulationPath run, can start reading data. Function readAntares ! readAntares main function package. used read every possible time series performs treatments make life easier. result function simplest structure possible: either simple table list tables asks data differents elements (instance links areas) huge number parameters control exactly get, optional. Without argument function still works read synthetic results areas. can import kind output. examples: can also choose elements import level details want. instance, following command reads first 10 Monte-Carlo scenarii data monthly time step areas named “area1”, “area2” “area3”. Finally many arguments readAntares can used add input time series object returned function. instance, misc=TRUE add columns containing miscelaneous productions imported areas.
code: # Synthetic results for all links readAntares(links="all")  #Synthetic results for all clusters readAntares(clusters="all")  # Areas and links at the same time readAntares(areas="all", links="all")  # Select only a few columns.  readAntares(select = c("OV. COST", "OP. COST", "LOAD")) readAntares(areas=c("area1", "area2", "area3"), timeStep="monthly",             synthesis=FALSE, mcYears = 1:10)

title: The 'antaresRead' Package
text: readAntares returns either single table list tables depending query user. precisely tables data.table objects. possible use powerful syntax offered package data.table. general syntax like: instance, areas[area == "08_fr", .(timeId, LOAD)] return table containing columns timeId LOAD area names “08_fr”. select statement, also possible calculate new columns. instance, one can compute net load like : One can also compute aggregated statistics. instance, following code compute total load areas per timeId: course, aggregation also works filters. instance compute total load french areas (assuming names contain “fr”): familiar package data.table, look documentation especially vignettes package:
code: name_of_the_table[filter_rows, select_columns, group_by] areas[, .(area, timeId, netLoad = LOAD - `ROW BAL.` - PSP - MISC. - NDG -                                     H. ROR - WIND - SOLAR)] areas[, .(totalLoad = sum(LOAD)), by = .(timeId)] areas[area %in% getAreas("fr"), .(totalLoad = sum(LOAD)), by = .(timeId)] help(package="data.table")

title: The 'antaresRead' Package
text: readAntares can import almost everything everything data time series. functions exist read specific data: readBindingConstraints read binding constraints, readClusterDesc read cluster characteristics readLayout get coordinates areas user interface Antares. parameters readAntares functions wait vectors area names link names. large projects lots areas. may painful specify hand long list areas links. Hopefully, functions getAreasand getLinks can used select exclude areas using regular expressions. instance, let us assume name areas located France start characters”fr”, following command returns list french areas: exclude offshore production areas (assuming name contains word “offshore”) one can use: functions provided package. see list , type console:
code: getAreas("fr") getAreas("fr", exclude="offshore") help(package = "antaresRead")

title: Import, Manipulate and Explore the Results of an Antares Simulation
text: Load package Select Antares simulation interactively. can also select programmatically: parameter simulation can name simulation, name folder containing simulation results, index simulation. 1 corresponds oldest simulation, -1 newest one, 0 inputs.
code: library(antaresRead) setSimulationPath() setsimulationPath("study_path", simulation)

title: Import, Manipulate and Explore the Results of an Antares Simulation
text: data simulation can imported R session function readAntares(). many parameters control data imported. examples: Functions getAreas getLinks helpful create selection areas links interest. examples:
code: # Read synthetic results of all areas of a study with hourly time step. areaData <- readAntares(areas = "all")  # Same but with a daily time step: areaData <- readAntares(areas = "all", timeStep = "daily")  # Read all Monte Carlo scenarios for a given area. myArea <- readAntares(areas = "my_area", mcYears = "all")  # Same but add miscelaneous production time series to the result  myArea <- readAntares(areas = "my_area", mcYears = "all", misc = TRUE)  # Read only columns "LOAD" and "MRG. PRICE" areaData <- readAntares(areas = "all", select = c("LOAD", "MRG. PRICE")) # select areas containing "fr" myareas <- getAreas("fr")  # Same but remove areas containing "hvdc" myareas <- getAreas("fr", exclude = "hvdc")  # Get the links that connect two of the previous areas mylinks <- getLinks(myareas, internalOnly = FALSE)  # Get the results for these areas and links mydata <- readAntares(areas = myareas, links = mylinks)

title: Import, Manipulate and Explore the Results of an Antares Simulation
text: one type elements imported (areas links, etc.) readAntares() read antares returns data.table extra attributes. data.table table enhanced capacities offered package data.table. particular provides special syntax manipulate content: examples: familiar package data.table, look documentation especially vignettes package:
code: name_of_the_table[filter_rows, select_columns, group_by] # Select lines based on some criteria mydata[area == "fr" & month == "JUL"]  # Select columns, and compute new ones mydata[, .(area, month, load2 = LOAD^2)]  # Aggregate data by some variables mydata[, .(total = sum(LOAD)), by = .(month)]  # All three operations can be done with a single line of code mydata[area == "fr", .(total = sum(LOAD)), by = .(month)]  help(package = "data.table") help(package="data.table") vignette("datatable-intro")

NULL, links connected one areas omitted. opts list simulation parameters returned function setSimulationPath internalOnly TRUE, links connect two areas parameter areas returned. , function also returns links connect area list area outside list. namesOnly TRUE, function returns vector link names, else returns table containing name, origin destination selected link. withDirection Used namesOnly = FALSE. title: Read the data of an Antares simulation — readAntares
text: areas Vector containing names areas import. NULL area imported. special value "" tells function import areas. default, value "" argument enter "NULL" arguments enter. links Vector containing name links import. NULL area imported. special value "" tells function import areas. Use function getLinks import links connected areas. clusters Vector containing name areas want import results thermal cluster level. NULL cluster imported. special value "" tells function import thermal clusters areas. districts Vector containing names districts import. NULL, district imported. special value "" tells function import districts. clustersRes Vector containing name areas want import results renewable cluster level. NULL cluster imported. special value "" tells function import renewable clusters areas. clustersST Vector containing name areas want import results short-term cluster level. NULL cluster imported. special value "" tells function import short-term clusters areas. bindingConstraints binding constraints imported (v8.4+)? misc Vector containing name areas want import misc. thermalAvailabilities thermal availabilities clusters imported ? TRUE, column "thermalAvailability" added result new column "availableUnits" containing number available units cluster created.synthesis set TRUE "availableUnits" contain mean avaible units MC Years. hydroStorage hydro storage imported ? hydroStorageMaxPower hydro storage maximum power imported ? reserve reserve imported ? linkCapacity link capacities imported ? mustRun must run productions added result? TRUE, four columns added: mustRun contains production clusters complete must run mode; mustRunPartial contains partial must run production clusters; mustRunTotal sum two previous columns. Finally thermalPmin similar mustRunTotal except also takes account production induced minimum stable power units cluster. precisely, given cluster given time step, equal min(NODU x min.stable.power, mustRunTotal). thermalModulation thermal modulation time series imported ? TRUE, columns "marginalCostModulation", "marketBidModulation", "capacityModulation" "minGenModulation" added cluster data. select Character vector containing name columns import. argument NULL, variables imported. Special names "allAreas" "allLinks" indicate function import variables areas links. Since version 1.0, values "misc", "thermalAvailabilities", "hydroStorage", "hydroStorageMaxPower", "reserve", "linkCapacity", "mustRun", "thermalModulation" also accepted can replace corresponding arguments. list available variables can seen command simOptions()$variables.  Id variables like area, link timeId automatically imported. Note select taken account importing cluster data. mcYears Index Monte-Carlo years import. NULL, synthetic results read, else specified Monte-Carlo simulations imported. special value tells function import Monte-Carlo simulations. timeStep Resolution data import: hourly (default), daily, weekly, monthly annual. mcWeights Vector weights apply specified mcYears. NULL, vector must length vector provided mcYear parameter. function readAntares return weighted synthetic results specified years, specified weights. opts list simulation parameters returned function setSimulationPath parallel importation parallelized ? (See details) simplify TRUE one type output imported data.table returned. FALSE, result always list class "antaresData". showProgress TRUE function displays information progress importation.

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Import areas and links separately  areas <- readAntares() # equivalent to readAntares(areas="all") links <- readAntares(links="all")  # Import areas and links at same time  output <- readAntares(areas = "all", links = "all")  # Add input time series to the object returned by the function areas <- readAntares(areas = "all", misc = TRUE, reserve = TRUE)  # Get all output for one area  myArea <- sample(simOptions()$areaList, 1) myArea  myAreaOutput <- readAntares(area = myArea,                             links = getLinks(myArea, regexpSelect=FALSE),                             clusters = myArea)  # Or equivalently: myAreaOutput <- readAntaresAreas(myArea)  # Use parameter "select" to read only some columns.  areas <- readAntares(select = c("LOAD", "OV. COST"))  # Aliases can be used to select frequent groups of columns. use showAliases() # to view a list of available aliases  areas <- readAntares(select="economy")  } # }

COST, OP. COST, CO2 EMIS. text: path (optional) Path simulation. can either path directory containing antares project directly directory containing output simulation.  missing, window opens lets user choose directory simulation interactively. Can also choose .h5 file, rhdf5 installed. simulation (optional) used "path" represents path study output simulation. can either name simulation number indicating simulation use. possible use negative values select simulation last one: instance -1 select recent simulation, -2 penultimate one, etc. two special values 0 "input" tells function user interested results simulation, inputs. case, function readAntares unavailable. host character host AntaREST server API study_id character id target study API token character API personnal access token timeout numeric API timeout (seconds). Default 60. See also setTimeoutAPI httr_config API httr configuration. See config

title: Set Path to an Antares simulation — setSimulationPath
text: list containing various information simulation, particular: studyPath path Antares study simPath path simulation inputPath path input folder study studyName Name study simDataPath path folder containing data simulation name name simulation mode type simulation: economy, adequacy, draft input synthesis synthetic results available ? yearByYear results Monte Carlo simulation available ? scenarios Monte-Carlo scenarii stored output ? important reconstruct input time series used Monte-Carlo simulation. mcYears Vector containing number exported Monte-Carlo scenarios antaresVersion Version Antares used run simulation. areaList Vector available areas. districtList Vector available districts. linkList Vector available links. areasWithClusters Vector areas containing clusters. areasWithResClusters Vector areas containing clusters renewable. areasWithSTClusters Vector areas containing clusters storage (>=v8.6.0). variables Available variables areas, districts links. parameters parameters simulation. binding Table time series dimensions group (>=v8.7.0). timeIdMin Minimum time id simulation. generally equal one can higher working subperiod. timeIdMax maximum time id simulation. start Date first day year simulation. date corresponds timeId = 1. firstWeekday First day week. districtsDef data.table containing specification districts. energyCosts list containing cost spilled unsupplied energy. verbose logical default FALSE, put TRUE manage diagnostic messages sleep timer api commande execute

title: Set Path to an Antares simulation — setSimulationPath
text: simulation chosen setSimulationPath setSimulationPathAPI becomes default simulation functions package. behavior fine working one simulation, may become problematic working multiple simulations time. case, can store object returned function variable pass variable functions package (see examples).

title: Set Path to an Antares simulation — setSimulationPath
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Select interactively a study. It only works on windows.  setSimulationPath()  # Specify path of the study. Note: if there are more than one simulation # output in the study, the function will asks the user to interactively choose # one simulation.  setSimulationPath("path_of_the_folder_of_the_study")  # Select the first simulation of a study  setSimulationPath("path_of_the_folder_of_the_study", 1)  # Select the last simulation of a study  setSimulationPath("path_of_the_folder_of_the_study", -1)  # Select a simulation by name  setSimulationPath("path_of_the_folder_of_the_study", "name of the simulation")  # Just need to read input data  setSimulationPath("path_of_the_folder_of_the_study", "input") # or setSimulationPath("path_of_the_folder_of_the_study", 0)  # Working with API #-------------------------- setSimulationPathAPI(     host = "http://antares_api_adress",      study_id = "study_id_on_api",      token = "token" )  ## Custom httr options ?  # global using httr package require(httr) set_config(verbose()) setSimulationPathAPI(     host = "http://antares_api_adress",      study_id = "study_id_on_api",      token = "token" )  reset_config()  # or in setSimulationPathAPI setSimulationPathAPI(     host = "http://antares_api_adress",      study_id = "study_id_on_api",      token = "token",     httr_config = config(verbose = TRUE) )  # disable ssl certificate checking ? setSimulationPathAPI(     host = "http://antares_api_adress",      study_id = "study_id_on_api",      token = "token",     httr_config = config(ssl_verifypeer = FALSE) )  # WORKING WITH MULTIPLE SIMULATIONS #---------------------------------- # Let us assume ten simulations have been run and we want to collect the # variable "LOAD" for each area. We can create a list containing options # for each simulation and iterate through this list.  opts <- lapply(1:10, function(i) {    setSimulationPath("path_of_the_folder_of_the_study", i) })  output <- lapply(opts, function(o) {   res <- readAntares(areas = "all", select = "LOAD", timeStep = "monthly", opts = o)   # Add a column "simulation" containing the name of the simulation   res$simulation <- o$name   res })  # Concatenate all the tables in one super table output <- rbindlist(output)  # Reshape output for easier comparisons: one line per timeId and one column # per simulation output <- dcast(output, timeId + areaId ~ simulation, value.var = "LOAD")  output  # Quick visualization matplot(output[area == area[1], !c("area", "timeId"), with = FALSE],          type = "l") } # }

title: antaresRead 0.4 (2016-04-29)
text: BREAKING CHANGES: parameters output “readAntares” modified. output now three components: nodes, links clusters. user asks information like hydro storage links capacities, added corresponding component. corresponding parameters now expect TRUE/ FALSE instead vector node link names. “getLinks” now parameters behavior “getNodes” Parameter “trace” removed “setSimulationPath”. NEW FEATURES: “readAntares” new argument “mustRun” “removeVirtualNodes” finalised New function “simOptions” get either global simulation options simulation options used “readAntares” create given object New alias “nosum” remove “min”, “max”, “std” columns “synthesis=TRUE” “readAntares” “setSimulationPath” new argument “simulation” choose simulation name order inside antares project New function “getDistricts” New function “copyToClipboard” Added package vignette

title: antaresRead 0.3 (2016-04-14)
text: NEW FEATURES: “readAntares” can now read hydro storage, hydro storage maximum power, reserve links capacity New function “readAntaresNodes”: read desired data set nodes New function “readBindingConstraints” New function “changeTimeStep”: change timestep “antaresOutput” object table containing variable timeId New function “getNodes”: select filter nodes antares study “extractDataList” improved better compatibility PPSE scripts Improved documentation New function removeVirtualNodes (still experimental) Added NEWS file :)

title: antaresRead 0.2 (2016-04-05)
text: BREAKING CHANGES: “readOutput” renamed “readAntares” NEW FEATURES: “readAntares” can now read thermal availabilities “setSimulationPath” now reads simulation parameters “setSimulationPath” now accepts path study eventually asks user choose output Nodes sets now separated “readAntares” “setSimulationPath” aliases groups variables parameter “select” “readAntares”
